ARABIC: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُلْ ءَاذَنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍ وَإِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ أَم بَعِيدٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If they turn their backs, then say: 'I have informed all of you equally and I do not know if what you have been promised is near or far.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If they turn away, tell them: "I have warned you all alike. I do not know if what has been promised you is near or far away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised is near or distant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If they turn away, tell them, "I have warned every one of you equally. I do not know when the torment which you have to suffer will take place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then if they turn away, proclaim, “I have proclaimed a war against you on equal terms; and what do I know whether the promise which is given to you, is close or far?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But if they turn away say: "I give you a notice to be known to us all alike. And I know not whether that which you are promised is near or far."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But if they turn back, say: I have given you warning in fairness and I do not know whether what you are threatened with is near or far;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then, if they should turn their backs, say: 'I have proclaimed to you all equally, even though I know not whether near or far is that you are promised.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike, although I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If they turn away, say, "I have warned you all alike, though I do not know whether [the scourge] which you are promised is near at hand or far off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then if they turn away, say thou: I have proclaimed unto you all alike, and I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But if they turn away, say, ‘I have proclaimed to you all alike, and I do not know whether what you have been promised is far or near.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But if they turn back, Say: "I have proclaimed the Message to you all alike and in truth; but I know not whether that which ye are promised is near or far.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But if they (disbelievers, idolaters, Jews, Christians, polytheists, etc.) turn away (from Islamic Monotheism) say (to them O Muhammad SAW): "I give you a notice (of war as) to be known to us all alike. And I know not whether that which you are promised (i.e. the torment or the Day of Resurrection) is near or far."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If they turn back, say: 'I have warned you all alike, though I cannot tell whether what you are promised is imminent or distant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But if they turn away, say, “I have informed you sufficiently. Although I do not know whether what you are promised is near or far.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:109] But if they turn away, from this, say: ‘I have proclaimed to you, I have notified you of [my declaration of] war [on you], all alike (‘alā sawā’ is a circumstantial qualifier referring to both the subject of the verb and the object) that is to say, you are [all] equal in having knowledge of this: I shall not proceed independently without [having first informed] you, in order for you to make preparations, although I do not know whether near or far is that which you have been promised’, with respect to chastisement, or to the [Day of] Resurrection that comprises this [chastisement]; only God knows it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But if they are averse) from faith and sincerity, (then say) to them, Muhammad: (I have warned you) I have informed you, and as such you and I have become (all alike) both of us are openly aware of the matter and there is no secret, (although I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised) of chastisement.
